Vacancy.Description:
David Lewis is an Employer of Choice

We offer a market leading salary of £18,222.77 - £19,787.63

£18,936 - £20,562 (assuming 1 in 3 weekends) and the opportunity earn more with regular overtime.

33% premiums for working weekends and up to 3 times your basic salary on bank holidays.

Contracts:

Full time (5 shifts over 37.5 hours per week)

Part-time (3 shifts over 22.5 hours or 4 shifts over 30 hours)

We are looking for Support Workers who like us believe that every individual matters and have a passion to be the best at everything they do. No experience or qualifications are needed as we provide a comprehensive accredited induction and training.

Other benefits include:-

  • Up to 38 days annual leave
  • An occupational pension (up to 6%)
  • Up to 12 weeks full sick pay
  • Life Assurance Cover (3 x basic annual salary)
  • NVQ Level 2 and 3 in Health and Social Care
  • Further Education Sponsorship
  • Career Progression
  • A comprehensive health and wellbeing provision including an Employee Assistance Programme, Occupational Health service and a dedicated Workplace Mentor
  • On site gym and swimming pool
  • Free parking
  • Xmas gift cards

From 11th November 2021 it will be a requirement that anyone working in a (CQC) Care Quality Commission registered care home in England for residents requiring nursing or personal care to have received 2 doses of a COVID-19 vaccine unless they have a medical exemption.

We support people with complex learning and physical disabilities with their daily living, access to social and leisure opportunities and education.

“Every day is different. Every day I can see that I am making a difference to someone’s life. It’s such a rewarding job” Sian (Support Worker).

David Lewis provides care 24 hours per day, 365 days per year. Hence, the post does require working early, late and weekend shifts as required.

Shift times are as follows:

Education & Lifeskills: Early - 7.30am - 4.30pm; Late 4.00pm - 10.00pm

Pathways & Community: Early - 7.30am - 3.00pm; Late 2.00pm - 9.30pm

Vacancy.Title: Support Worker (Care)

Vacancy.Description:
We are looking to recruit a Lifeguard to work in our onsite Swimming Pool. Providing the highest standards of care and protection for our service users within the Swimming Pool, you will work unsupervised to open and close the pool. During opening hours you will work with your colleagues to ensure compliance with Pool Safety Operating Procedures.

The successful applicant will be a confident swimmer with a level of fitness commensurate with the role.You will possess a current National Pool Lifeguard Qualification (essential) as well as a National Pool Plant Operators certificate (desirable) or be willing to complete this (sponsorship will be provided).Knowledge of COSHH guidelines and IT literacy is desirable.

As well as the opportunity to work form a picturesque site in a rural setting other benefits include:-

  • Up to 30 days annual leave plus public holidays.
  • An occupational pension (up to 6% employer contribution)
  • Up to 12 weeks full sick pay
  • Life Assurance Cover (3 x basic annual salary)
  • Further Education Sponsorship
  • Career Progression
  • A comprehensive health and wellbeing provision including:-
  • an Employee Assistance Programme
  • Occupational Health services
  • A Physiotherapy service for staff
  • A Staff Counsellor
  • On site pharmacy
  • Free parking
  • Digital Rewards

For more information about David Lewis please visit www.davidlewis.org.uk or call Donna Ogden on 01565 640165.

Note, we will interview on application.

David Lewis welcomes applications from a diverse talent pool.

To request any reasonable adjustments to support you with the application or shortlisting process please contact 01565 640196.

Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) Checks: This post, due to its nature, duties and responsibilities, will be subject to an enhanced check by the DBS.
Vacancy.Title: Lifeguard

item.title: College Daytime Care Officer/ Learning Support Assistant (Education)

Vacancy.Description:
College Daytime Care Officer/ Learning Support Assistant (Education)

Actual Salary: £13,903 to £15,632 per annum

33.75 hours per week Monday to Friday – Term Time Only.

Shift Times: 9.15am – 4pm daily

We are looking for Support Workers who like us believe that every individual matters and have a passion to be the best at everything they do. No experience or qualifications are needed as we provide a comprehensive accredited induction and training.

Benefits include: -

  • Up to 38 days annual leave
  • An occupational pension (up to 6%)
  • Up to 12 weeks full sick pay
  • Life Assurance Cover (3 x basic annual salary)
  • NVQ Level 2 and 3 in Health and Social Care
  • Further Education Sponsorship
  • Career Progression
  • A comprehensive health and wellbeing provision including an Employee Assistance Programme, Occupational Health service and a dedicated Workplace Mentor
  • On site gym and swimming pool
  • Free parking
  • Xmas Rewards

The College at David Lewis provides education and care for young adults with severe, profound and complex learning difficulties/disabilities, sensory impairments, communication disorders and autism. We’re looking for talented and caring Care Officderswho want to make a real difference, working on a one to one basis with our students, supporting their learning, and a range of other daily tasks.

“Every day is different. Every day I can see that I am making a difference to someone’s life. It’s such a rewarding job” Sian (Support Worker).

To request any reasonable adjustments to support you with the application or shortlisting process please contact us.

Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) Checks: This post, due to its nature, duties and responsibilities, will be subject to an enhanced check by the DBS.

Note, we will interview on application.

COVID-19 considerations:
Full infection control policy and procedure in place with designated infection control lead. All staff required to be fully COVID vaccinated by 11 Nov 2021.
Vacancy.Title: College Daytime Care Officer/ Learning Support Assistant (Education)

Vacancy.Description:
We are looking to recruit a Health and Social Care Trainer to provide training, support and guidance to staff to enable them to perform to their potential to deliver the expected standard of service.

We have a state of the art dedicated training facility onsite.

The successful candidate will work closely with the Learning and Development Manager and clinical professionals to identify training needs, design, develop and deliver session plans and learning interventions, online and classroom based, as part of the annual training plan.

It is essential that candidates hold a Level 3 qualification in health and social care and ideally hold a relevant qualification in adult education and training as well as being competent (and accredited where necessary) to deliver moving and handling, medication management, first aid and CPR and epilepsy awareness training.

The successful candidate will likely be an experienced trainer who has worked for 2 or more years in a clinical or care setting delivering elements of care and undertaking clinical work under the supervision of registered professionals, with a level of skill beyond that of the traditional support worker. An understanding of learning disabilities, autism and epilepsy would also be advantageous.

David Lewis provides outstanding education, residential, medical and therapeutic support for people with learning disabilities, epilepsy and autism for people aged 16 years and over. We employ over 850 staff with a turnover of £28 million per annum. We support people with complex learning and physical disabilities with their daily living, access to social and leisure opportunities and education.

As well as the opportunity to work form a picturesque site in a rural setting other benefits include:-

· Up to 38 days annual leave

· An occupational pension (up to 6%)

· Up to 12 weeks full sick pay

· Life Assurance Cover (3 x basic annual salary)

· Further Education Sponsorship

· Career Progression

· A comprehensive health and wellbeing provision including:-

· an Employee Assistance Programme

· Occupational Health services

· A Physio service for staff

· A Staff Counsellor

· On site pharmacy

· On site gym and swimming pool

· Free parking

· Digital Rewards

To request any reasonable adjustments to support you with the application or shortlisting process please contact 01565 640142.

Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) Checks: This post, due to its nature, duties and responsibilities, will be subject to an enhanced check by the DBS.

Informal Enquiries may be made to: Simon Priest, Learning and Development Manager on 01565 640000.

Reference ID: DL/HSCT/Sept21

Application deadline: 07/10/2021

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: £25,000.00-£30,000.00 per year
Vacancy.Title: Health and Social Care Trainer

Vacancy.Description:
Clinic Receptionist

19.5 hours per week (0.52 FTE)

Wednesday – Friday 6.5 hours per day

£9,769.24 per annum (0.52 FTE of £18,727.01 1 FTE)

We are looking to recruit to a Clinic Receptionist to provide administrative support within the clinic department.

The role of Clinic Receptionist will involve greeting service users and staff, maintaining the appointment calendar, telephone duties and message taking; archiving, management of samples for collection, some health and safety duties and any other ad-hoc tasks.

The successful candidate will be warm and friendly with excellent communication skills; they will be flexible and committed to working as part of a team. Experience in Microsoft Office is essential and familiarity with medical terminology and experience with, or willingness to learn, the medical records system EMIS would also be highly desirable.

David Lewis is an Employer of Choice, based near Alderley Edge, we are at the forefront of care, education, assessment, treatment and skill development for people aged 16 years upwards with complex needs including epilepsy, physical and learning disabilities and other neurological conditions.

As one of the largest employers in the area, with Investors in People status, meeting the needs of our employees is also our priority and we are committed to helping you achieve your career goals.

Location:

We are based near Alderley Edge, Cheshire

Other benefits include:

  • Up to 38 days annual leave
  • An occupational pension (up to 6%)
  • Up to 12 weeks full sick pay
  • Life Assurance Cover (3 x basic annual salary)
  • NVQ Level 2 and 3 in Health and Social Care
  • Further Education Sponsorship
  • Career Progression
  • A comprehensive health and wellbeing provision including an Employee Assistance Programme, Occupational Health service and a dedicated Workplace Mentor
  • On site gym and swimming pool
  • Free parking
  • Xmas gift cards

From 11th November 2021 it will also be a requirement that anyone working in a (CQC) Care Quality Commission registered care home in England for residents requiring nursing or personal care to have received 2 doses of a COVID-19 vaccine unless they have a medical exemption.

Therefore we will require you to provide evidence of your COVID-19 vaccination status or medical exemption as part of your pre-employment checks.

David Lewis welcomes applications from a diverse talent pool.

To request any reasonable adjustments to support you with the application or shortlisting process please contact 01565 640107.

Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) Checks: This post, due to its nature, duties and responsibilities, will be subject to an enhanced check by the DBS.
Vacancy.Title: Clinic Receptionist

Vacancy.Description:
David Lewis is an employer of choice. We are looking to recruit Registered Nurses to join our team of experienced nurses. The principle responsibility will be to provide emergency cover to all the service users at David Lewis. This would include emergency care/first aid and management of head injuries.

This multifaceted clinical role provides active support to the GP service 24 hours a day, 365 days a year. You will be an integral part of the healthcare team and will be involved in everything from clinical triage to the evaluation of patient care and standards within a learning disability environment. You’ll carry out and develop nurse led clinics, undertake relevant assessments and examinations, organise and provide necessary treatment and refer patients to other healthcare professionals when there is a need.

As part of the David Lewis you will also support and guide care staff and deliver some training to enable them to develop and maintain skills to safely care for our service users.

Once in post, the successful candidate will be given training (approx. 49 hours) in all advanced clinical assessment skills and Patient Group Directives (PGD’s). You will be required to complete an OSCE assessment to a satisfactory standard before progressing further in the role.

Candidates must be a Registered Nurse and have experience working in a similar role with some knowledge of conditions such as epilepsy, autism, and learning disabilities.

David Lewis provides outstanding education, residential, medical and therapeutic support for people with learning disabilities, epilepsy and autism for people aged 16 years and over. We employ over 850 staff with a turnover of £28 million per annum. We support people with complex learning and physical disabilities with their daily living, access to social and leisure opportunities and education.

As well as the opportunity to work form a picturesque site in a rural setting other benefits include:-

  • Up to 38 days annual leave
  • An occupational pension (up to 6%)
  • Up to 12 weeks full sick pay
  • Life Assurance Cover (3 x basic annual salary)
  • Further Education Sponsorship
  • Career Progression
  • A comprehensive health and wellbeing provision including:-
  • an Employee Assistance Programme
  • Occupational Health services
  • A Physio service for staff
  • A Staff Counsellor
  • On site pharmacy
  • On site gym and swimming pool
  • Free parking
  • Digital Rewards

Closing date: Wednesday 6th October 2021. Note, we will interview on receipt of application.

For an informal chat about the roles, please contact Victoria Entwistle, Director of Clinical Services on 01565640193.

David Lewis welcomes applications from a diverse talent pool.

To request any reasonable adjustments to support you with the application or shortlisting process please contact 01565 640142.

Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) Checks: This post, due to its nature, duties and responsibilities, will be subject to an enhanced check by the DBS.
Vacancy.Title: Registered Nurse (full and part-time)
